text: I'm Venkatraman on the CEO of the Azim
Premji foundation to give some idea
about our organization we primarily work
in the space of Education the idea is to
improve the quality of education in this
country we work with the government
schooling system we are present in about
six states and 45 districts across India
in one in some of the most
underdeveloped regions of this country
we also run the same brains University
and not report University where we offer
programs in education development public
policy and governance from the
perspective of challenges in terms of
computing and the computing needs here
we have a very diverse set of people and
a diverse set of requirements many of
our members actually have started using
laptops for the very first time in their
lives so because of that you know it's
very important that there is ease of use
a lot of flexibility and the advantages
for us there were we had no legacy
systems and no real IP concerns
otherwise you'll have to worry about
migrating these legacy systems you know
what IP you have and whether it is safe
secure on the table etcetera etcetera so
we do not have any server on promise we
are completely on the cloud coming
specifically to AWS I think what I would
consider as a very significant milestone
on a significant achievement for us and
for all of us were being involved in
this is the PeopleSoft implementation we
just went like few months back and from
the beginning we were very clear that we
wanted it on the cloud and in the
process of evaluating it we did look at
a few of the service providers but it
was very clear that it will be AWS which
actually would meet our requirement and
help us going forward there were quite a
few of critical points there one I think
was about the data base so one advantage
we got or
going on AWS was we could actually pay
for use you know pay-as-you-go model
even for having the database at the back
end and of course the scale see today we
are about thousand five hundred people
and there is a plan to go up to ten
thousand people in the next four to five
years
it might materialize it might not
materialize but I don't think we should
be no we should invest so much upfront
so it makes a lot of sense for us to
scale as we go pay as we go as we scale
rather so I would say the experience has
been very good the support from Adan
from the ALW stream has been fantastic
and I would say it's been a fantastic
experience
